business.headline: SIP vs RD: Where should your monthly savings go?Would you rather sleep peacefully or grow wealthy quietly? That's essentially what the SIP vs RD debate boils down to. Both allow disciplined monthly investing, but one protects capital while the other builds it. So which one deserves your money?

Man flags extra charge on cash-on-delivery payments, Centre launches probeThe Department of Consumer Affairs has launched an investigation into e-commerce sites charging additional fees on cash-on-delivery payments.

Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs is a sorry tale of grease of doing business in IndiaChennai-based logistics company Wintrack has ceased Indian operations, alleging repeated bribery demands and harassment by Chennai Customs, exposing the ugly truth that at Indian Customs integrity is the real contraband.

Delhi government may revise circle rates, public feedback invitedThe Delhi government is considering a revision of circle rates across the city and has called on the public to share their views before any changes are finalised.

Health insurance in 2025: Key traps that could drain your pocketClauses such as room rent caps, deductibles, and co-pay options are often buried deep in policy documents but can have a massive influence on the claim process.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end higher fuelled by gains in metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 223.86 points to close at 81,207.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 57.95 points to end at 24,894.25.

63% of households aware, yet only 9.5% invest in markets, Sebi survey showsDespite growing awareness about investing in the markets, the latest Sebi survey shows that only a small fraction of households, i.e., just 9.5%, are actively investing.

Looking for high returns? This small savings scheme beats PPF and NSCMany investors assume PPF or NSC offer the best returns, but the scheme leads the pack with the highest interest among small savings schemes. Have a look.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs: If forced to bribe, can companies fight legally?The Finance Ministry has already ordered an official probe, but the matter has also raised a wider debate: if businesses are forced to pay bribes to get their consignments cleared, do they have the law on their side?

Will Zerodha end its zero-brokerage model for equity delivery trades?Zerodha, long known for offering free equity delivery trades, could soon charge for delivery trades for the first time, signalling a major shift for investors.

entertainment.headline: Saiyaara's Aneet Padda opens up on scam auditions, cold emailing 70 producers Actor Aneet Padda opened up about her early struggles before fame, sharing how she once sent audition tapes and cold emails to dozens of production houses in search of work.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 4: Rs 300 crore in sight, biggest Kannada opener Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' is set to cross Rs 300 crore at the box office after a strong four-day run. The film has become the third highest grossing Kannada movie, challenging previous records.

Bigg Boss 19's Abhishek Bajaj breaks silence on Akansha Jindal's cheating claims 'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Abhishek Bajaj responds to his ex-wife Akansha Jindal's claims of infidelity during their marriage. Bajaj calls the allegations "heartbreaking and deeply unfair" while urging the media not to promote negative narratives.

Smriti Irani makes runway comeback after 26 years with symbolic walk. Watch Smriti Irani made a return to the fashion runway after 26 years. She walked barefoot, which many saw as a statement of authenticity.

Kantara Chapter 1 fan dressed as Daiva stuns audience at Dindigul screening 'Kantara: Chapter 1' earned more than Rs 150 crore at box office in three days. A fan dressed as Panjurli deity drew attention at the Dindigul screening.

Rajinikanth enjoys spiritual break in Rishikesh, relishes meal roadside Veteran actor Rajinikanth took a break from his professional commitments and embarked on a spiritual journey to the Himalayas. Pictures of him leading a simple life away from stardom have emerged online.

Why Elon Musk is angry 3 years after Netflix cancelled 'Dead End: Paranormal Park' 'Dead End: Paranormal Park', the show that drew Elon Musk's ire, was cancelled after two seasons, but the series is still available on Netflix

Travis Kelce's ex Kayla Nicole breaks silence on Taylor Swift's Opalite Taylor Swift releases her twelfth studio album, 'The Life of a Showgirl', sparking speculation over the track 'Opalite'. Kayla Nicole, Travis Kelce's former partner, shares posts interpreted by many as responses to the song.
Arbaaz Khan, wife Sshura welcome first child: Sources Actor Arbaaz Khan and Sshura Khan welcome their first child. Sshura was admitted to PD Hinduja Hospital hours before the birth.

Kerala government honours Mohanlal after Dadasaheb Phalke win Kerala government honoured veteran actor Mohanlal for receiving the Dadasaheb Phalke Award. The ceremony, held in Thiruvananthapuram, was attended by Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan.

Dhanashree Verma shares cryptic post after Samay Raina, Yuzvendra Chahal's banter Stand-up comic Samay Rana's post referencing Yuzvendra Chahal sparked debate online. Soon after his video, Dhanshree Verma shared a cryptic post which is believed to be a dig at Raina.

Bigg Boss 19 ep 42: Salman Khan jokes with Elvish Yadav as he appears on show Internet personality Elvish Yadav appeared on 'Bigg Boss 19' for a Weekend Ka Vaar episode. Salman Khan greeted Elvish with his catchphrase and introduced a task for contestants.

Netflix cap drops around $15 billion after Elon Musk's boycott call Elon Musk's boycott Netflix call sends shares tumbling, sparking a new culture clash. His posts on X came after he cancelled his own subscription to the streaming platform while taking a dig at it.

Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl sparks global orange door hunt Taylor Swift launched an international promotional puzzle for her new album. Orange doors with QR codes have appeared in cities such as London and Berlin.

Hina Khan opens up on taboo around cancer in the entertainment industry Actor Hina Khan discusses the stigma surrounding cancer among artists and advocates for continued work. The actor shares her experience after being diagnosed with stage three breast cancer.

Anshula Kapoor honours late mother with engagement outfit, Maheep performs duties Maheep Kapoor performed mother duties at Anshula Kapoor and Rohan Thakkar's Gor Dhana ceremony. Attended by family members, several pictures from the event have emerged online.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 3: Rishab's film earns Rs 160 crore, beats Sikandar Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara Chapter 1' surpassed the 150-crore mark in three days. The film has set the cash registers ringing at Rs 162 crore.

Sunny Sanskari box office Day 3: Varun, Janhvi's entertainer eyes Rs 30 crore Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor's rom-com 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' has earned Rs 22 crore at the box office despite receiving mixed reviews. After dipping on Day 2, the film bounced back on its third day with collections of Rs 7.25 crore.

Anita Hassanandani crowned winner of reality show Chhoriyan Chali Gaon Actor Anita Hassanandani was announced as the winner of the reality show 'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon.' The show highlighted rural life and tested celebrities with traditional tasks.

general news.headline: 7 patients dead in Jaipur hospital fire, families allege staff fled after blazeFamilies of the victims have alleged that the staff fled soon after the blaze, suspected to have been caused by a short circuit, erupted on the second floor of the state-run Sawai Man Singh Hospital in Jaipur.

Pak minister's 'burial' threat after Indian Army chief's 'erase from map' warningPakistani Defence Minister Khawaja Asif warned India of severe consequences, following comments from Indian Army chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi about erasing Pakistan from the world map if it failed to stop terrorism on its soil.

Violence, arson, internet shut in Cuttack after Durga Puja clashes; VHP calls bandhCuttack city remained tense after violent clashes erupted during Durga Puja idol immersion near Haathi Pokhari. The violence, triggered by objections to high-decibel music, led to stone-throwing, injuries, including Cuttack DCP Khilari Rishikesh Dnyandeo, and damage to vehicles and stalls.

Didn't allow him to sleep: Zubeen Garg's bandmate blames manager, fellow musicianPartha Pratim Goswami claimed that Siddharth Sharma (Garg's manager) and Shekhar Jyoti Goswami (fellow bandmate) kept Zubeen Garg from resting and took him to the sea for their own amusement, which was a reckless mistake.

12-0: India dismantle Pakistan in Colombo to extend dominance, top tableWomen's World Cup 2025, INDW vs PAKW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India extended their dominance over Pakistan with a thumping 88-run win over their arch-rivals on Sunday, October 5 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

Move fast: Trump's 'massive bloodshed' warning if Hamas doesn't agree to Gaza planTrump's remarks come just hours after his warning that Hamas will face "complete obliteration" if it does not cede power and control in Gaza as per his peace plan. The deadline for Hamas ended at 6 pm Washington time (EDT) on Sunday -- 3:30 am IST on Monday.

Reported sale of JF-17 jet engines to Pakistan will benefit India: Russian expertsRussian defence experts said the reported sale of RD-93 engines to Pakistan could benefit India in two ways, dismissing opposition criticism in New Delhi.

Indian-origin motel owner shot dead in US after asking gunman, 'Are you alright?'The victim, Rakesh Ehagaban, was killed by Stanley Eugene West, who also shot a woman and a detective before being arrested. Investigators said the attack appeared deliberate and unprovoked.

Watch: Hikaru Nakamura throws D Gukesh's king into the crowd after Checkmate winWorld No.2 Hikaru Nakamura courted controversy during the Checkmate tournament as he threw D Gukesh's king after beating him in the match on Saturday, October 4. India were soundly beaten by the USA on the day.
Video: RSS chief likens POK to 'room in our home', says it must be reclaimedMohan Bhagwat's remarks came days after Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said India would regain POK "without aggression."
Learn How Adobe Express Is Making Graphic Design Fun In ClassroomsThe Adobe Express app is available on any smart device or desktop computer.

Muneeba Ali controversial run out in India vs Pakistan clash: MCC law explainedMuneeba Ali was controversially run out against India in the Women's World Cup at the R Premadasa Stadium, leaving Pakistan frustrated over the umpire's decision.

Indian manager denies sick leave to employee with headache, WhatsApp chat goes viralAn Indian manager's response to an employee asking for sick leave due to a headache has sparked online debate after their WhatsApp chat went viral.
Case against Telangana MLA for controversial remarks on Prophet MuhammadT Raja Singh allegedly made the controversial remark during a Dussehra event in Madhya Pradesh's Indore.

Masked men torch UK mosque with worshippers inside, cops suspect hate crimeTwo individuals wearing balaclavas tried to force their way into the mosque on Saturday night, and when they failed, they poured gasoline on the steps and set them on fire.

Putin's offer on nuclear arms control sounds like good idea, says TrumpPutin last month offered to voluntarily maintain limits capping the size of the world's two biggest nuclear arsenals set out in the 2010 New START accord, which expires in February, if the US does the same.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 4: Rs 300 crore in sight, biggest Kannada openerRishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' is set to cross Rs 300 crore at the box office after a strong four-day run. The film has become the third highest grossing Kannada movie, challenging previous records.
How IIM Ahmedabad defies placement trendsWith Rs 35 lakh average salary for the business management and Rs 20 lakh for agribusiness graduates, IIMA's placement holds steady amid global headwinds.

Poll body announces 17 new reforms for Bihar polls; to be adopted nationwide laterThe Election Commission has introduced identity cards for booth-level officials, mobile phone deposits outside polling stations, and full webcasting, aiming to make Bihar's Assembly elections more transparent.

Why do doctors have horrible handwriting, and can it be cured?Medical prescriptions that are nothing but scribbles and scrawls are very common. Bad handwriting of doctors is a problem faced regularly by patients and pharmacists, and recently saw a stern observation by a high court in a medico-legal case. Here's why doctors have bad handwriting and the way to fix illegible prescriptions.

Chiranjeevi, Jackie Shroff, Khushboo and stars celebrate 80s reunion bashA bevy of stars gathered to celebrate the 80s Stars Reunion, an annual tradition in the South Indian film industry, held in Chennai on October 4. Take a look at the pictures here.

Centre steps in as child deaths linked to cough syrup surge, UP launches probeThe Union Health Ministry convened a high-level meeting after Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh reported 18 child deaths linked to contaminated cough syrups, urging states to act swiftly through bans, investigations and public advisories.

Is he mentally fit? Tejashwi Yadav flags Nitish Kumar's 'bizarre antics' in videoBihar's political drama continues as RJD leader and Leader of the Opposition Tejashwi Yadav again raised questions about Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's mental fitness and ability to lead.

Rajinikanth enjoys spiritual break in Rishikesh, relishes meal roadsideVeteran actor Rajinikanth took a break from his professional commitments and embarked on a spiritual journey to the Himalayas. Pictures of him leading a simple life away from stardom have emerged online.

sports.headline: 3rd T20I: Saif Hassan helps Bangladesh complete series sweep over Afghanistan Bangladesh completed a commanding 3-0 clean sweep over Afghanistan in the T20I series in Sharjah, successfully executing their chase in all three matches.

Focus on bowling, not on India-Pakistan talk: Kranti reveals her success mantra India's newest pace sensation Kranti Gaud revealed that she remains unfazed by the hype surrounding the India-Pakistan rivalry, saying her focus is solely on her bowling. The young pacer starred with a match-winning spell as India defeated Pakistan by 88 runs in their ICC Women's World Cup clash in Colombo.

Unable to even walk due to cramps, Jannik Sinner retires from Shanghai Masters World No.2 Jannik Sinner limped off the court in the third round of the Shanghai Masters. Sinner, facing intense cramps, had to be carried out by his physio.

Women's World Cup: Dodgy India need to tighten up despite dream start India are sitting atop the Women's World Cup table, but poor DRS decisions, sloppy catching, and inconsistent batting highlight cracks that could cost them against stronger teams like Australia and England.

Can't dwell on one performance, it's a long tournament: Sinalo Jafta South Africa wicketkeeper batter Sinalo Jafta said that their team will not dwell too much on the opening match horror against England as they have a long tournament ahead. The Proteas women will next take on New Zealand in their second fixture in Indore.

IND-A vs AUS-A: Prabhsimran hundred helps India A win 3rd ODI and claim series Prabhsimran Singh's blazing hundred and fifties from Shreyas Iyer and Riyan Parag helped India close out a thrilling win against Australia A to win the 3rd ODI and claim the series 2-1 on Sunday, October 5.

Want to win World Cup for pioneers of Indian women's cricket: Jemimah Rodrigues India women's cricket team continues their unbeaten streak with a dominant win over Pakistan. The squad aims to honour past pioneers by winning the 2025 Women's World Cup.

World Cup: Village watches on giant LED screen as Kranti Goud shines against Pakistan Kranti Goud was thrilled with her performance against Pakistan and said that her family had installed a big LED screen to watch the game on Sunday, October 5. Goud picked up three wickets to help India beat Pakistan comprehensively.

Pakistan captain Fatima Sana sprays pest control in IND vs PAK clash, video goes viral Women's World Cup: Fatima Sana sprayed pest control to tackle a fly infestation during the clash against India. She also starred with the ball after taking two wickets.

12-0: India dismantle Pakistan in Colombo to extend dominance, top table Women's World Cup 2025, INDW vs PAKW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India extended their dominance over Pakistan with a thumping 88-run win over their arch-rivals on Sunday, October 5 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

After England horror, South Africa confident of bouncing back vs New Zealand South Africa aim to recover after a heavy defeat in their Women's World Cup 2025 opener against England. The Proteas women got all out for 69 and suffered a ten-wicket defeat in their first fixture.

Want to win World Cup for pioneers of Indian women's cricket: Jemimah Rodrigues India women's cricket team continues their unbeaten streak with a dominant win over Pakistan. The squad aims to honour past pioneers by winning the 2025 Women's World Cup.

World Cup: Village watches on giant LED screen as Kranti Goud shines against Pakistan Kranti Goud was thrilled with her performance against Pakistan and said that her family had installed a big LED screen to watch the game on Sunday, October 5. Goud picked up three wickets to help India beat Pakistan comprehensively.

Pakistan captain Fatima Sana sprays pest control in IND vs PAK clash, video goes viral Women's World Cup: Fatima Sana sprayed pest control to tackle a fly infestation during the clash against India. She also starred with the ball after taking two wickets.

12-0: India dismantle Pakistan in Colombo to extend dominance, top table Women's World Cup 2025, INDW vs PAKW: Harmanpreet Kaur's India extended their dominance over Pakistan with a thumping 88-run win over their arch-rivals on Sunday, October 5 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

After England horror, South Africa confident of bouncing back vs New Zealand South Africa aim to recover after a heavy defeat in their Women's World Cup 2025 opener against England. The Proteas women got all out for 69 and suffered a ten-wicket defeat in their first fixture.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
